title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland 

(Education and Training) (Integrated Course) (Amendment) Rules 2021. 

(2) The Principal Rules, Rule 14 of the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland 
(Continuing Professional Development) Rules 2015 (S.I. No. 553 of 2015), the 
Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Education and Training) (Integrated Course) 
(Amendment) Rules 2017 (S.I. No. 97 of 2017), the Rules of 2020 and these 
Rules may be cited together as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Education 
and Training) (Integrated Course) Rules 2014 to 2021.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: In these Rules—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Rules— 

“Principal Rules” means the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Education and 
Training) (Integrated Course) Rules 2014 (S.I. No. 377 of 2014); 

“Rules of 2020” means the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Education and 
Training) (Integrated Course) (Amendment) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 148 of 2020).

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 3. Rule 14 (as amended by Rule 4 of the Rules of 2020) of the Principal
text_raw:
3. Rule 14 (as amended by Rule 4 of the Rules of 2020) of the Principal 

Rules is amended by substituting for paragraph (1A) the following: 

“(1A) Notwithstanding paragraph (1) and Rule 6(b), in the exceptional 
circumstances arising from the Covid-19 emergency, the in-service practical 
training requirement set out in paragraph (1) may be reduced, at the discretion 
of the recognised institution, to a requirement to complete 10 months of inservice practical training consisting of— 

(a) 

at least four months of the training referred to in paragraph (1)(a), 
and 

(b) not less than six months of the training referred to in paragraph 

(1)(b).”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th February, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 I, STEPHEN DONNELLY, Minister for Health, consent to the making of the 
foregoing Rules. 

[79] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 February, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Council of the 
Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland, 

3 February, 2021. 

JOANNE KISSANE 

President. 

NIALL BYRNE 
Registrar. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [79]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules continue in force the special provision allowing recognised 
institutions, in the exceptional circumstances arising from the Covid-19 
emergency, to reduce the requirement that fifth year pharmacy students complete 
eight consecutive months of in-service practical training under the direct 
supervision of a tutor pharmacist, in a registered retail pharmacy business in the 
State or in the pharmacy department of a hospital in the State, to a requirement 
that they complete six months of such training. 

These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Education 
and Training) (Integrated Course) (Amendment) Rules 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [79] 5
